result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Morgan Ann Moreno

records.addlTxt:
11:19 AM - cases called - 22CF141 and 22CF145 (tracking).  Defendant Morgan Ann Moreno appeared by video, in custody from Taycheedah.  Attorney James H Krave appeared by video for Morgan Ann Moreno.  Attorney Andrew Polzin in court for State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Polzin regarding plea agreement.  Court questions Atty Krave/Defendant.  Responses by Atty Krave/Defendant.  Defendant consents to appearing via Zoom.  Plea to Count 1 is guilty.  Plea to Count 4 is guilty.  Waiver of rights and tendering plea.  Waiver free and voluntary.  Defendant acknowledges the restrictions that go along with a felony conviction.  Factual basis exits for plea.  Found guilty by the Court on Counts 1 and 4.  Counts 2, 3 and 5 - DRI.  Joint recommendation.  Statement by Atty Polzin/Atty Krave/Defendant/Court regarding sentencing.  Court orders a 4 year sentence to the Wisconsin State Prison System (concurrent to any other sentence being served) consisting of 2 years initial confinement followed by 2 years extended supervision with the conditions of extended supervision being absolute sobriety - may not possess or consume alcohol or controlled substances except for any prescribed medications in the prescribed dosages, may not enter any premises licensed for the sale or service of alcohol, AODA assessment and compliance with treatment recommendations and a fine in the amount of $500.00 plus cc/sc.  Court finds the Defendant is eligible for programming.  42 days sentence credit.  Post conviction rights given.  Discussions regarding Extradition in 22CF145.  Defendant has a sentencing hearing in November in Dakota County, MN and has paid the $1,000 cash bond in that case.  Statement by the Court.
Status conference scheduled for December 6, 2022 at 09:45 am.
Status conference on December 6, 2022 at 09:45 am.
